channel.title: Running a server on linux - Can't find a file
channel.description: [root@ventus Ventus]# bash run.sh [root@ventus Ventus]# Error: Could not find or load main class poi.jareps. Why does this happen? where should this file be? If I don't have it where would I find it?

item.title: Running a server on linux - Can't find a file
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

Based on the information provided…
The error is straightforward.
The shell script was looking for the main class jareps which was in the poi package… And it couldn’t.
So, you need to make it exist or make the shell script read the proper path to it.

Read full topic
item.source: Running a server on linux - Can't find a file

item.title: Running a server on linux - Can't find a file
item.dc:creator: @matzie matzie
item.description:
@matzie wrote:

[quote=“Pker DX, post:1, topic:551943”][root@ventus Ventus]# bash run.sh
[root@ventus Ventus]# Error: Could not find or load main class poi.jareps.
Why does this happen? where should this file be? If I don’t have it where would I find it?[/quote]
Are you trying to run it as a jar? Is there a folder named poi in the same directory as run?

Read full topic
